posts.post_content: To get infinite Storm you have to CAST the spells. Izzet Guildmage Says: "2R: Copy target sorcery spell you control with converted mana cost 2 or less. You may choose new targets for the copy.". You copy the spell, so it's impossible to achieve infinite storm with Izzet Guildmage.
posts.html:
To get infinite Storm you have to CAST the spells. Izzet Guildmage Says: "2R: Copy target sorcery spell you control with converted mana cost 2 or less. You may choose new targets for the copy.". You copy the spell, so it's impossible to achieve infinite storm with Izzet Guildmage.

posts.post_content:
You cannot replicate it infinitely. You have to have the mana in your pool before it resolves to replicate it.   
  
If you only have {R} in your mana pool, you can only cast it one time. It's not quite infinite but still a good way to beef up your mana for a replicated bolt or something along those lines.
posts.html:
You cannot replicate it infinitely. You have to have the mana in your pool before it resolves to replicate it.

If you only have {R} in your mana pool, you can only cast it one time. It's not quite infinite but still a good way to beef up your mana for a replicated bolt or something along those lines.

posts.post_content:
An enabler for my favorite ridiculous turn 0 win:  
  
[Mox Opal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Opal) x3  
[Rite of Flame](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Flame) x3  
[Dragonstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragonstorm)  
  
4 [Bogardan Hellkite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bogardan Hellkite)s  
[Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund)  
[Dragon Tyrant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Tyrant)  
  
If you have 3 opponents, this can kill 2 of them outright and put a 3rd at 1 life. It's utterly overkill and requires the perfect 7 cards, but is nevertheless my favorite combo.

Posted By: cplmontana (12/21/2011 10:33:05 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@cplmontana  
  
Why Pyretic Ritual? 2x Rite of Flame would net more mana.  
  
The first Rite of Flame = spend 1 red mana for 2 red mana. The second Rite of Flame = spend 1 red mana for 3 red mana, which is strictly better than spending 1 red + 1 colorless for 3 red mana.  
  
The only reasons I see for going Rite of Flame-->Pyretic Ritual would be if you're playing EDH and can only have a single copy of any given card or your opponent has graveyard hate.
posts.html:
@cplmontana

Why Pyretic Ritual? 2x Rite of Flame would net more mana.

The first Rite of Flame = spend 1 red mana for 2 red mana. The second Rite of Flame = spend 1 red mana for 3 red mana, which is strictly better than spending 1 red + 1 colorless for 3 red mana.

The only reasons I see for going Rite of Flame-->Pyretic Ritual would be if you're playing EDH and can only have a single copy of any given card or your opponent has graveyard hate.
